com.jde.model.physics.collision

Class HitPolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jde.model.physics.collision.HitPolygon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HitZone

    public class HitPolygon
extends java.lang.Object
implements HitZone
    This HitPolygon class represents a colliding object with a convex polygon shape
    Author:
    HarZe (David Serrano)

      • collides

        public boolean collides(Movement self,
               Movement other,
               double ms)
        Description copied from interface: HitZone
        This method checks if an entity collides with a moving point
        Specified by:
        collides in interface HitZone
        Parameters:
        self - The movement of the entity which contains the hit zone, MUST BE a clone
        other - The movement of the point that is supposed to collide, MUST BE a clone
        ms - The milliseconds to forward
        Returns:
        True if the entities collide

      • cyrusBeck

        protected boolean cyrusBeck(Movement self,
                Movement other,
                double ms)
        This method uses the Cyrus-Beck algorithm to check piercing
        Parameters:
        self - Movement (position) of this polygon
        other - Movement of the piercing object
        ms - Time to forward
        Returns:
        True if the object pierces the polygon

      • isInside

        public boolean isInside(Movement self,
               Vertex other)
        Description copied from interface: HitZone
        This method checks if a point is inside the hit zone
        Specified by:
        isInside in interface HitZone
        Parameters:
        self - The movement of the entity which contains the hit zone
        other - The position to check
        Returns:

      • pierces

        protected boolean pierces(Movement self,
              Movement other,
              double ms)
        This method detects if a moving point is piercing the polygon
        Parameters:

        other - Movement of the piercing object

        Returns:
